headline.main: DR. HAROLD DIEHL OF CANCER SOCIETY; Researcher Who Warned of Perils in Smoking Dies

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Harold S. Diehl, a former director of research and medical affairs at the American Cancer Society, died yesterday of heart disease at United Hospital in St. Paul, where he was visiting. He was 81 years old and lived at 11 Riverside Drive.
docs.snippet: Dr. Harold S. Diehl, a former director of research and medical affairs at the American Cancer Society, died yesterday of heart disease at United Hospital in St. Paul, where he was visiting. He was 81 years old and lived at 11 Riverside Drive.

headline.main: Heart Association Strengthens Its Advice: Cut Down on Fats; Cholesterol Scored

docs.abstract: Amer Heart Assn recommends that Amers switch to leaner diet containing less saturated fat and cholesterol by eating fewer eggs and less animal and dairy fats
docs.lead_paragraph: The American Heart Association yesterday strengthened its recommendation that Americans curb their consumption of some of their most beloved foods-prime ribs, ice cream, butter, bacon, sausages, cold cuts and the like-and switch to a leaner diet containing less saturated fat and cholesterol.
docs.snippet: The American Heart Association yesterday strengthened its recommendation that Americans curb their consumption of some of their most beloved foods-prime ribs, ice cream, butter, bacon, sausages, cold cuts and the like-and switch to a leaner diet...
